text: A small hill on Sand Point within Magnuson Park, with a view of Lake Washington on three sides Lake Washington viewed from the shore on Sand Point Sand Point is a peninsula that juts into Lake Washington from north Seattle, Washington, United States. It is mostly occupied by Magnuson Park and gives its name to the Sand Point neighborhood to the west. Formerly a U.S. naval air station, it is mostly public park area, but with a portion occupied by NOAA. Sand Point was used as a game location in The X-Files: The Game. Category:Landforms of Seattle Category:Peninsulas of Washington (state) Category:Landforms of King County, Washington
title: Sand Point (peninsula)
